page.title: 08COCKFIELD PRIMARY SCHOOL 3
page.content: Children travel to our school in four ways;by bus,by car,by bicycle or on foot.The Suffolk Education Authority provides a mini-bus to transport children from Thorpe Morieux.Some who live less than two miles from the school are allowed to travel on this bus if they are on the route and pay a fee.15 children are using the bus this term.5 children cycle regularly,9 children walk and 34 children are brought to school in cars, usually driven by mothers.To help children to cycle properly,the school runs Cycling Proficiency Courses each year. 5th Year children are able to take an examination,conducted by a policeman, and if they pass they are presented with a Certificate.We make visits to places of interest from our school and in recent years we have been to Norwich Castle Hedingham,Whipsnade and Easton.
